website_summaries.verdict: Nice smelling substrate that clumps just like kitty litter, this walnut-based substrate is an excellent alternative to desert sand for species like bearded dragons, uromastyx, or monitors.
pros: Made with ground English walnut shells
Will not scratch glass, as natural sand does
cons: If your reptile is prone to eating its substrate, it may hurt as it passes through the system

customer_reviews.title: I find it rather amusing at the number of reviewers ...
customer_reviews.text: I find it rather amusing at the number of reviewers who have purchased this product for something other than it's intended use as reptile litter. I, too, bought the bag for an afternoon sewing group pin cushion project. There were 8 ladies who each made 2 pin cushions, and I still came home with almost 1/2 a bag left over! I'm not sure how much it weighs--over 10lbs, I'm guessing--so be prepared to make a LOT of pin cushions if you opt for this bag. Thankfully, I plan on giving pin cushions as Christmas gifts so I'm sure I'll be able to use up the rest of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dizzy Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for bearded dragons
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a bearded dragon because of high ratings but then ended up at the vet because he wasn’t pooing. I was told to get rid of this substrate immediately as it can cause impaction issues with reptiles. Removed it all from his terrarium and would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: JT1

customer_reviews.title: I like this stuff but my 2 year old bearded dragon ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this stuff but my 2 year old bearded dragon got really painful impaction from ingesting this walnut bed. He has always had sand for substrate and never ingested that. I guess this stuff smelled tasty. I'd watch your pet if you do get this. It is really nice and doesn't leave dust plumes and it doesn't discolor your pet like sand does. I'm so disappointed because I really do like this bedding. Would probably be great for other reptiles.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysWright

customer_reviews.title: Great for adults. Not so good for baby dragons.
customer_reviews.text: I have 17 bearded dragons and almost all of my cages have this stuff. I don't recommend for juveniles and babies as the grains are a bit large. Any Dragon 9+ months will be fine though. It cleans well, has a great smell and clumps around poop like kitty litter. I dig it!
customer_reviews.author: GreatThingsForUs

customer_reviews.title: Works great for polishing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as ammunition brass cleaning / polishing media. Works great for polishing, not so great for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: ACC

customer_reviews.title: Great brass tumbling media!
customer_reviews.text: Filled my tumbler 2/3 full of this stuff, then added a little Flitz polish and let it run for 10 minutes to distribute evenly. Dumped the brass in and let it go for an hour or so. I’m very pleased with the results, and it is a great price compared to name brand reloading media. It does get a little dusty after a few uses. No big deal- I wipe the bowl out afterwards. This is fairly small for crushed walnut shell, so be sure to check your primer pockets. I only had 3 out of 200 get media stuck in them, but it did happen.
customer_reviews.author: Fisher 2

customer_reviews.title: Bottomless Bag
customer_reviews.text: I like walnut shells for my pin cushions. I find when I make my own with all shell and no additional fillers, the pin cushion comes out better. This is a giant bag of shells, so it was easy for me to not only finish the project I intended for myself, but there will be loads of left overs for little gifts for others. The material wasn't too dusty, and easy to pour through a little kitchen funnel. It was exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: spinaz

customer_reviews.title: Great to clean reloading dies, leaves brass cartridges with dull luster.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my brass tumbler. It worked great on some old rusty reloading dies. I added a few ounces of Nu-Finish and ran them for 12 hours. Amazingly it removed the rust and left the dies looking like new. I also tried it on my empty brass, and it left them looking scratched and dull. I am glad I kept my old corncob media because it works much better for brass than the walnut shell. Be careful if using this for your brass because you might lose that new brass luster.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Gary

customer_reviews.title: At best it's ok, at worst it can kill your pet.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be the loose substrate solution for my bearded dragon without busting my bank... I was wrong. At best, this is a bland, uninviting, sharp and uncomfortable substrate for your pet. In addition, if your pet licks their environment (like my Bearded Dragon) they'll get this in their system, all over their food, etc. A real mess, and a quick way to get an impacted pet. Go with either a tile substrate, a 50/50 mix of top soil and play sand for loose substrate, or look at the Bio Dudes Terra Sahara substrate. (my solution I'm going with).
customer_reviews.author: Justin S.

customer_reviews.title: What a waste !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a timely manner, however it had a hole in it and leaked into and out of the shipping box. All the other items were covered in walnut shells and were spread throughout my house, I was covered and my dog and cat were covered in the shells.. I am disabled and I am totally exhausted and frustrated from cleaning up this mess , the plastic bag leaked because it was not sealed properly (it was not damaged in shipping) I will not buy this product again nor do I recommend this company.
customer_reviews.author: Weis

customer_reviews.title: Beardie approved!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my bearded dragon. This is the closest that I can get to a natural enclosure without getting calcium sand or any sand. This clumps and keeps odors at bay. Not once have I had a smelly cage and I've been using this for nine years. She absolutely loves this stuff because she can dig and bury herself if she wants too.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: For reloading
customer_reviews.text: I have using this for media for cleaning brass while reloading. I add some mineral spirit and NuFinish to the mix and the brass comes out polished clean with no dust or debris. I haven't needed to change it out yet as I've only done about 1000 cases, so unsure of longevity. Also, not sure if this does much help, but I also tear up a dryer sheet into about 2" squares and add them to the media to help collect grime. Doesn't hurt and seems to help even more.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cleaning shell cases
customer_reviews.text: Used it to clean/polish my rifle brass. Works great for a fraction of the price of costly specialty shell case media, which runs about twenty dollars for about one bag of this media, same stuff. I add about a cap full of Nu finish liquid polish and turn on the tumbler for a few hours, brass come out like new, had no sticking of media in primer pockets. I had bought two bags, but they are large only needed one, same some money and get this, it works!
customer_reviews.author: Paul perron

customer_reviews.title: It works great though, not nearly as sticky as sand
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragons eye infection from sand has finally cleared up. This stuff is a little thicker then sand as it goes through my sand strainer slower. It works great though, not nearly as sticky as sand. Your dragon will love you for this. Leaps and bound better then sand.
customer_reviews.author: coupleobudz

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Effective cleaner with Nu Finish polish in vibratory cleaner machine. This is only stuff I have used in Quick-n-EZ Case Tumbler. May be a better way but I like this cleaning method. Plenty of free range lizards here, no terrariums to need bedding.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lee Elliott

customer_reviews.title: It works great, both cleaning and shining my brass
customer_reviews.text: I use this to clean my brass. It works great, both cleaning and shining my brass. I do add a lil mineral spirits to help with the shine, but even without that it works well. It leaves a slight dusting on inside of the case but that doesn't bother me...no issues with residue on outside of cases. I don't deprime (obviously they are spent cases, not live primers) before cleaning so I don't have an issue with material getting stuck in primer hole but it will get in there without a primer...nothing that isn't easily remedied by blowing out. I don't reload/clean more than maybe a 100 rds/month, so this 10lb bag will last me until the 2nd Coming
customer_reviews.author: CMC777

customer_reviews.title: No dust with this bag of ground walnut shell.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for filling a tailor's ham and I would say that sawdust would have perhaps been better for that because this is one heavy tailor's ham, but despite its weight the ham works well and it sure doesn't wiggle around on the ironing board. Also made a twenty inch long tailor's ham for sleeves which turned out very well. These ground walnut shells are really dandy for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: mary e riley

customer_reviews.title: Making cell phone stands with this as a filler
customer_reviews.text: With a rectangle of fabric and this crushed walnut shell product I can make a handy cell phone stand. This is a fairly large bag and the price was very good. Found a much larger bag at a much higher price per pound at the pet store that was too much material for my needs. Clean shells, no dust. Good crafting supply. I don't have a reptile so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: June Schwierjohn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for brass cleaning media
customer_reviews.text: I use this as brass cleaning media in my tumbler. Works just as well as walnut hull media sold by the big reloading companies, at a fraction of the price. It would probably work pretty well for its intended purpose as lizard bedding, too.
customer_reviews.author: devik

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for parrot cage bottoms.
customer_reviews.text: Work well in cage bottom for parrots. Make sure they don’t have access to it tho, it can make them very sick. As long as you have a sire cage grate above it all it well. Good neutral smell, lasts a good long time. Small enough particles to go through strainer well.
customer_reviews.author: scf

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Easier to clean it's like a litterbox lol buts he enjoys hiding too lol
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Works great for brass case tumbling
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lizard and use this for brass case tumbling. This works great, lasts a long time, an brings used brass cartridges to a high luster in a brass tumbler. Product was cheaper than Pet Smart prices for iguana bedding. Arrived on time, does a good job, and competitively priced.
customer_reviews.author: Byron J. Guidry

customer_reviews.title: A easy to clean, no smell.  Looks good too.
customer_reviews.text: Two bags are plenty for a 40gal leopard gecko mansion. I bought three because I didn’t deal like doing the math lol. I like this bedding because it looks like desert sand my girls are in a desert themed habitat. I find it easy to scoop and it fluffs back up no problem. With that said, know that it does pack down like sand but is still a loose medium. Also, it doesn’t smell.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Tracee Drysdale

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for tumbling brass
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for tumbling brass, not pet bedding. For brass tumbling, it works quite well, and is a lot cheaper than dedicated 'made for tumbling' media. Works way better than old, dusty, worn out media. If you're tumbling brass, buy some.
customer_reviews.author: Mommicked

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for bird cages.
customer_reviews.text: We love this stuff for our bird cages- the birds have an easier time walking on this than on wire at the bottom of cages. Easy to clean by just scooping it- no messy paper and all that.
customer_reviews.author: SummitTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have a bearded dragon and he does really well with this product in his habitat. He doesn’t eat it so there isn’t any fear of impaction like few others have stated. It also does the job with oder control when it comes to his bowel movements.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Used for pin cushions
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this for making pin cushions but it worked. This is a good substitute for the Emery sand. It will keep your pins sharp and clean. Also it is SO MUCH EASIER to push a pin in this rather than a cotton pin cushion.
customer_reviews.author: A.D.

customer_reviews.title: I Buy This Alot
customer_reviews.text: It is the best walnut "substrate." Clean, non-smelling, consistent size, and just the right size. There is another one from another company, but those walnut bits are very fine and small. I like the size of these better and priced just right.
customer_reviews.author: Consumption Gumption

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I like the product because when pouring it into the bottom of a bird cage, there is very little dust. It is super absorbant and my birds don't fling it out of their cages like they could with the cob bedding. It's also a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturers bag is too fragile for shipping
customer_reviews.text: The bag I received doesn't look like the one that is pictured. It was split open and most of the contents are most likely still in a UPS plane or truck somewhere. The other three items I ordered with this were all contaminated with walnut shell dust. If you order this, order it alone and don't open the shipping carton in your house!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Walnut grounds
customer_reviews.text: As some of the others posted, I don't use this for reptile housing, but for a cleaning medium in a vibrating tumbler. Smells great, feels great, gets brass super clean. I guess if I had a reptile, I'd feel pretty good about them hanging out on this stuff too.
customer_reviews.author: y4kk3r

customer_reviews.title: Brass cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I use this for cleaning my brass after a shooting range session it's half the price of the stuff that that says it's specifically for reloading it's the same exact stuff that you would pay $18 for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This could be a little more coarse, but still a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for litter at the bottom of my birds cages. It is great for that use. The pieces could be a "bit" larger, but what can one expect when they use a lizard litter for a birds cage.
customer_reviews.author: Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pin Cushions!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this for my pin cushions. I was drawn to this one because of the price. It’s pretty fine but if you put a piece of batting between the fabric and shells it works fabulously!!!
customer_reviews.author: STAR STRUCKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sand alternative! 5/5
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. We use this for our snake's terrarium. Before using this Walnut shell, we had colored terrarium sand and vita-sand and crap like that. It's all bunk. The sands were always far too fine, and once we had a blue bag of sand (orange snake, blue sand. I thought the contrast would look cool) that covered EVERYTHING in a fine layer of blue dust. Never again, this walnut shell is the perfect alternative to sand, it's coarse enough to clean easily if you make a mess, but not so fine that it clouds up and hangs in the air. I would recommend this every time to any reptile owner.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: used to clean range brass
customer_reviews.text: excellent for cleaning range brass that was laying in the dirt for a long time , it polishes well better at removing tarnish than limishine and dawn brass comes out more polished and not just clean
customer_reviews.author: lf

customer_reviews.title: Filling for pin cushion
customer_reviews.text: Using for pin cushion. Great value for the cost. Arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Walkup

customer_reviews.title: Seem exactly right for a beardie.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for bedding for our bearded dragon. Seems to be better than the last “seedy” bedding he had. Not much dust. I’ll definitely reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Motherofbullies

customer_reviews.title: Sticks to my beardies feet if it he gets wet ...
customer_reviews.text: Sticks to my beardies feet if it he gets wet at all. He then starts eating it. Do yourself a favor and get the brown carpet substrate. Cheaper and won't kill your beardie.
customer_reviews.author: Foe-hammer

customer_reviews.title: Great media for tumbling brass cartridges
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for tumbling and cleaning brass cartridges. It is much cheaper and just as effective as other products deigned for the same task. I will be purchasing more from this vendor as I need it
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: Zues the Bearded Dragon love it!
customer_reviews.text: Zeus is such a happy fellow with his new "floor". He digs and looks much happier. And happy dragons is a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for reloading media
customer_reviews.text: Great for polishing brass and cleaning it up for reloading. I add a little bit of Nu-Finish car polish and a half of a dryer sheet when I run brass in my Frankford Arsenal Case Tumbler. It's a lot cheaper than the reloading specific crushed walnut, and it's the exact same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the poundage!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for not what you'd expect it's use for...brass cleaning! So much more cost effective pound for pound, I did a 3/1 ratio of this and spent brass casings and it came out nice and clean. It didn't polish them any, but I wasn't looking for shiny. I just wanted grime/dirt/powder removed, nice alternative.
customer_reviews.author: ID I Am

customer_reviews.title: Better than corn
customer_reviews.text: A perfect medium for cleaning brass...In my experience cheaper than corn, and provides much better shine and cleaning. A very durable product.
customer_reviews.author: tasone1

customer_reviews.title: Had a Desert spider that is very poisonous in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a Desert spider that is very poisonous in my bag that I found later on
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Please do t get for bearded dragon pet. It Han be hazardous when they digest it because they will eat this. My sons pet is very sick from this!!
customer_reviews.author: shawna

customer_reviews.title: Crafting Not Lizarding =)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use in handcrafted pincushions and was astounded by the amount I got for the price. It worked great because of the weight and size of particles.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great for filling pin cushions. I can normally fill 10-12 cushions with one bag of crushed walnut shells and for the price you just can’t beat it !! I have not smelled an odor and it pours thru a funnel very well.
customer_reviews.author: giggles

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tumbler media!
customer_reviews.text: This product works GREAT for brass tumbling. Size is approximately half of normal corncob/walnut stuff sold by Lyman/Frankford etc. which means it pours out of necked down rifle cases much easier and doesn't tend to clog primer pockets nearly as much. Cleans/polishes brass about 20-30%faster than my usual tufnut media. Added a 1/4 cup of nufinish cut with 3 tsp of mineral spirits and it really brought out the shine. Pictures are of Uncleaned and 1 hour tumbled brass, amazing results.
customer_reviews.author: FlyinHawaiian

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for making pin cushions or anything you need to stuff with walnuts , sewing related. they're wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Sl

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My Eastern Box Turtle, Balthazar, is the pickiest eater. He went on a hunger strike while I was trying to figure out what he liked to eat. That being said, he loves this stuff! He eats regularly now whereas before, he would munch, and then not eat for days. He eats early in the morning and then is more active as a result. I am so happy and will definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Justina

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this for my bearded dragons for a few years now. It works great. Super easy to clean. Better than sand in my opinion. Doesn't seem to have had a negative impact on my dragons in any way.
customer_reviews.author: J. Medrano

customer_reviews.title: More finely crushed than I expected But not pulverized.
customer_reviews.text: I use the product as a polishing medium in a tumbler on stones and small metal pieces. Works great but could use a snoot of rouge to speed up the polishing process. For the $, I have not found anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Whippersnapper3

customer_reviews.title: Great for bearded dragon
customer_reviews.text: Bearded dragon is very happy with it. Like that it has look of sand but is safe if ingested. Stays warm by the heat lamp.
customer_reviews.author: Angie E

customer_reviews.title: Great for sewing needs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fill pin cushions! Great quantity and quality! Recommend for craft needs when walnut shells are called for. This package will last me for YEARS!
customer_reviews.author: mkh

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Product was great quality and processed within tolerances for needed application. No dust in bag so sifted well before packaging. Ran product for 3 1/2 hours in tumbler, it did clean the brass which had set outside for over 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: better than new and I use these shells over and ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to polish brass in a Thumblers Tumbler. I add 4 tablespoons of Brasso and polish for 48 hours after I have washed and dried the brass with dishwashing liquid and lemishine overnight, then put it thru an oven for 3 hours @ 185 deg.. When done with that I use renew once a year car polish and add 4 tablespoons, polish another 48 hours. It leaves the brass shiny, better than new and I use these shells over and over again. I put a couple of sheets of fabric softener in with the brass to help absorb any dirt in the shells.
customer_reviews.author: easymoney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for filling pincushions. Much cheaper than the kind packaged for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Holliday Alford

customer_reviews.title: Great for my use
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fill a shooting bag that I needed on the rifle range at the club. It worked great and was just enough to fill both Caldwell DeadShot Boxed Front and Rear Bag that was delivered with it. Perfect for that! Search Amazon for this: "B000PW8KSM" to see the bags that it filled perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Produce for Pin Cushion Stuffing!
customer_reviews.text: After having purchased a kit on vacation for a pin cushion, I wanted to make some additional ones. This is a great deal, there is no bad smell to these crushed walnut shells, they are not too fine to "leak" out of cotton fabric, they are perfect. When making the pin cushion you have to resist the temptation to put too much in when stuffing it, because you have so much in reserve! Suggest sharing some with your sewing/quilting friends! Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Katyusha

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: This product is no longer walnut shells. It should be called walnut shell dust.
customer_reviews.author: ZDog

customer_reviews.title: bedding
customer_reviews.text: I've used this before with my bearded dragon and I love it so much better than the green stuff that pet stores use in the lizards cages. This stuff is awesome
customer_reviews.author: dacia rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Didn't use for reptiles but it's great in pincushion projects😃
customer_reviews.author: Linda J

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love how this looks in his terrarium. He seems to like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for soap making. This is a great price for that purchase, but honestly the grain size is a little large. If you're using for that purpose you'll want to stick these in the blender or coffee grinder for a few seconds. The product itself is very clean and uniform. No complaints at all. this would be excellent reptile bedding as well and it's the best price per pound I could find just about anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Led Jedi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My bearded loves this stuff I feel it’s much better than the sand he used to have only thing I don’t like is that it’s constantly getting in his food and water bowl
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fine grain mix
customer_reviews.text: This is a FINE GRAIN mix - was hoping for a rough grain mix so not ideal for my specific needs though overall good product
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good clean ground walnut shells
customer_reviews.text: I am going to use these in vibrating metal cleaner and expect good results when looking at the shells.
customer_reviews.author: NancyP

customer_reviews.title: Bearded dragon ground Walnut sand
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery excellent product! My lizard loves it and I love the 25lbs large bag! Thumbs up will definitely be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: TODD

customer_reviews.title: Good in a vibrating shell polishing machine.
customer_reviews.text: Used in my vibrating shell polisher. Works well with a little Flitz polishing compound added to the walnut shell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This will be great for filling pin cushions I am making
customer_reviews.text: I will use this to fill pin cushions. I will be making quite a few, so this large bag is plenty. If only making a one or a couple, find something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean with scoop and change after it is more dirty. Bearded dragon likes playing in it.
customer_reviews.author: Stc2581

customer_reviews.title: Bearded dragons love it
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 bearded dragon who love this beeding. Super worms can burrow in it easily as well which is fun watching the bearded dragons hunt. Super easy to clean and very inexpensive for bedding.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Berg

customer_reviews.title: Did not use as lizard bedding.
customer_reviews.text: After reading some customer review. Ended up using this as tumbling media for my brass. I've heard a lot about a 50/50 bled of walnut and corn cob. But honestly a tub full of walnut shells and a quick squirt of wax / polish and it comes out better looking than new brass. Since I have this running in the corner of an automotive shop, I can't comment on dust kick up. After the cycle is over, I just end up shaking the brass free of walnuts and give them a warm bath in just water to clean out anything left inside. Let it sit with a fan over it over night and its primed for the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Actually using this media in an ammo tumbler to polish rusty fishing lures and it works great. Gotta say, I think I have a 5 year supply so I may buy a smaller bag next time...
customer_reviews.author: Rick Y

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I regularly buy this product and is not as messy as sand! It is great for our bearded dragon...
customer_reviews.author: SL Fackler

customer_reviews.title: What the reloaders are talking about.  Much less expensive.  Just add NuFinish.
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised that it was ground so fine, but it's wahat all of the reviews was talking about. Haven't used it yet, but will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: fred peterman

customer_reviews.title: Works for a craft project
customer_reviews.text: This was for a craft project. After a while they seemed to settle and I had to add more.
customer_reviews.author: Carol M

customer_reviews.title: Best pin cushion stuffing
customer_reviews.text: I used this exclusively for stuffing pin cushions and it is perfect for this se.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Grandma

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my beardie. It gets everywhere. In his water and all over everything. He even started acting different. Then I read that they should not have any kind of substrate (sand, walnut shells, etc). It can cause impactions. I removed it all just about 2 weeks after I had put it in. He is doing better now. They need to be on a solid surface. This is more of a mess than anything. Now I have bought wood and bamboo placemats at Ross for just $4.99. They can use the reptile carpet or anything that the beardie won't get his nails stuck in or can accidentally ingest when he catches his food.
customer_reviews.author: Tia Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great for lightly tarnished reloading brass.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to clean brass for reloading. Not as coarse as corn cob media so it doesn't clean tarnished brass as well, at least without tumbling a lot longer. I clean my brass first in an ultrasonic cleaner for 10 to 15 minutes than tumble for a half hour. This works great for nickel and brass without a lot of tarnish, but takes several hours for what I consider typical tarnished brass. For heavier tarnish, I resort to the more expensive corn cob media.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Palermo

customer_reviews.title: It's got good texture, holds polish well
customer_reviews.text: As with a lot of buyers, I use it for case tumbling and polishing. It's got good texture, holds polish well, and got the cases clean quickly. Much cheaper than the same stuff repackaged as "polishing media."
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good polishing compound.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my Dillon case polisher and it works great. Low dust and lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Makes it much easier to clean up after my lizard after going potty!!
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful when it comes to cleaning poo out of my reptile's enclosure, it clumps up (kind of like kitty litter) when wet so its easy to get all the stuff out of the way!!
customer_reviews.author: Keidy Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Great fine texture filler
customer_reviews.text: Love that this product is shells that would otherwise be discarded. The nice fine texture makes it great for many products. No smell, great for environment!
customer_reviews.author: candivan

customer_reviews.title: Perf for tumblers
customer_reviews.text: Great for Lyman tumbler for your brass. Dose not get stuck in primer holes
customer_reviews.author: B.d.m.

customer_reviews.title: dusty mix
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for cleaning media and it left the parts dirtier. brown dust all around the tumbler. I'll give this away to someone that has a lizard
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Worked quite well.
customer_reviews.text: Used for cleaning brass shell casings in my vibratory cleaner. Works GREAT>
customer_reviews.author: Big Ed

customer_reviews.title: Works well for pincushions.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to fill pincushions I made. Much less expensive for the same thing sold in smaller bags earmarked specifically for pincushions.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Curley

customer_reviews.title: Used for Pin Cushions
customer_reviews.text: I used crushed walnut shells for the filling of my pin cushions. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Branson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pincushions
customer_reviews.text: Great for pincushions - very happy! I quilt my cotton top & bottom to batting pieces, join right sides together & stitch all around the outside, leaving a little opening to fill with walnut shells. I use a funnel to fill the pincushion & add a little polyester stuffing at the opening to keep tiny walnut granules from working their way through. Then, hand stitch opening closed. This is my second purchase of crushed walnut shells & am very happy with how the pincushions hold up over time, too.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin & Faith

customer_reviews.title: Great for brass tumbling
customer_reviews.text: I use this to tumble brass casings. It works great, and with no dust. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: My little lad loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and great price point. It clings to things when it's wet but once it dries out under the heat lamps it goes back to how it was. My lizard has had fun burying himself in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Worthless as is.  Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong grind. Pictures show a much coarser grind which is what I needed. What I got was a very fine sand type consistency which it totally worthless to me. Last time I'm going by anything SEEN in an advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Niles

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect making pin cushions. The walnut shells sharpen the pins.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Tumbling media
customer_reviews.text: Great tumbling media for brass and a lot cheaper than the stuff labeled for tumblers!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I love this finely crushed walnut substrate for all my reptiles because if they ingest some, it won't compact inside them like the sand does. One bag easily covers three 40 gallon tanks. It sifts well for clean up and has a nice smell. A bit dusty though.
customer_reviews.author: ROSIEWOLF

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel ate my nut shells
customer_reviews.text: There was some big holes it this bag when it got to me. Looks like a squirrel thought that there were still nuts inside the bag. Ground up nut cracks all over my order. Use Saran wrap to package this in, probably stronger than whatever is being used now.
customer_reviews.author: CanonIsBetter

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I use this over bark. My tortoise seems to like it and its easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Rita Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great Reptile Substrate
customer_reviews.text: This product works much better than sand as a substrate for tortoises and other reptiles. It is light weight compared to sand and is easy to work with. It is biodegradable because it is all natural.
customer_reviews.author: Kay from Milwaukee

product_meta.title: Zilla Ground English Walnut Shells Desert Blend
product_meta.description:
Size:5-Quart Bag| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingRecreate a reptileâ€™s desert habitat with attractive, 100% natural ground English walnut shell. Ground to a uniform size, this bedding provides a comfortable home for desert-dwelling reptiles by retaining heat. Ideal for Bearded Dragons, Monitors, Skinks & Uromastyx. This material is made in the USA, and can be readily composted with everyday yard waste.

AMAZON.COM




PRODUCT INFORMATION
Recreate a reptile’s desert habitat with attractive, 100% natural ground English walnut shell. Ground to a uniform size, this bedding provides a comfortable home for desert-dwelling reptiles by retaining heat. This material is made in the USA, and can be readily composted with everyday yard waste. For hatchling and juvenile reptiles, it is recommended to use a Zilla Terrarium Liner. 

HIGHLIGHTS
 * Creates a natural and attractive desert environment
 * Excellent heat conductor
 * Stimulates natural digging and burrowing behavior

IDEAL FOR
 * Bearded Dragons
 * Uromastyx
 * Monitors
 * Skinks

ZILLA BEDDING GUIDE
feature_bullets: 100% Natural ground English Walnut shells replicate natural habitats and create an attractive desert environment
Will not scratch glass like sand and provides excellent heat-conducting
Stimulates natural digging and burrowing behavior and is an excellent heat conductor
Ideal bedding depth in enclosure is 1 to 2-inches, remove and replace bedding monthly
Ideal for desert dwelling reptiles such as: adult bearded dragons, monitors, desert skinks and uromastyx

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
